Chap. 32 - Infatuation and Blind Love
[SEESECTION V, "LIFE'S ENERGIZING FORCE."]


     Courtship--Good Common Sense Needed.--The youth trust altogether too much to impulse. They should not give themselves away too easily or be captivated too readily by the winning exterior of the lover. Courtship, as carried on in this age, is a scheme of deception and hypocrisy, with which the enemy of souls has far more to do than the Lord. Good common sense is needed here if anywhere; but the fact is, it has little to do in the matter.--RH, Jan 26, 1886. (MYP 450.)
